posts.content:
Hi all, I have been busy in this period, and I am happy I can return to the building world!

I have thought, for a long time, to build a support PC; and, of course, I'm thinking of a bard character.
My idea is to have a Dexterity-based build; in order to benefit from this attribute-related advantage, I have chosen to provide to my character a decent ranged attack/finessed melee attack. As a first thought, I have splashed the bard class with a bit of arcane archer.
Then, my second step is to obtain Uncanny Dodge, to retain my Dexterity AC when flat-footed: for this reason, I decided to choose the elf race and to obtain UD from shadowdancer: this can ensure no-xp penalty and a slight DEX advantage than the outcomes of the half-elf path.
After a quick brainstorming, I came up with this draft below pasted.

I have chosen, for pre-epic levels, to maintain the spell progression. Then, after obtaining "lasting inspiration", to immediately take UD. However, after that, I am not sure of what feats to take on epic levels. 
Note that, as an alternative, I would have taken the 9 arcane archer levels in pre-epic levels, to obtain a slightly better AB (BARD12/AA8).

Some thoughts:
  • On epic levels, and with a DEX-based build, I immediately think about Epic Dodge! But I would have to obtain 10 levels of shadowdancer, and so drop a bit of arcane archer (taking a half-elf and a rogue would surely cost me more levels).
  • Lasting inspiration and armor skin are mandatory;
  • Feats that I would take on epic levels: Epic weapon focus longbow, great dexterity (at least 1, to arrive at 28 DEX), epic will (?), still spell (maybe not, as with high DEX and Uncanny Dodge and UMD I can use caster clothing)
  • Bard song: at hgher levels, I can raise perform with gloves of 30 points, so probably I wouldn't need the "Epic skill focus" feat.
  • Skills: as a support character, concentration would be mandatory, but I can't find the room for it. Don't know which skill to drop, as all of them seems relevant to me.
  • Same story for UMD: would like to maximize it, but I don't know if it would be relevant (as too many skills are useful, and some of them are mandatory to being able to take the shadowdancer levels).
I would like to stress that if you think that the support character can be reached also with a STR-based build (and maybe with better results), don't hesitate to provide advices (the following splashes come into my mind: Bard26/Fighter4/RDD10 or Bard26/CoT4/RDD10).

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Based on the intent of your character, I think you've made a good start on your character. Here are some suggestions based on your questions.

1. Change the starting stats to STR 10 and INT 14. Let the others carry loot :) and use the extra points from INT to increase your skills.
2. SD3 isn't really needed since you get Uncanny Dodge (and Evasion) with SD2. I think you can go Bard 30 / SD 2 / AA 8. Your Bard 12 / AA 8 option is good from the power builder perspective for the first 20 levels. Take SD1-2 at levels 21-22 and finish off with Bard. Bard 30 maxes out the song.
3. For your regular feats, take ESW: Longbow at 21 (as you've selected), Armor Skin, Epic Prowess and 4 Great Dexterities. For your Bard bonus feats, you can take Lasting Inspiration, ESF: Perform (keep it) and another Great Dexterity. This takes your final DEX to 32. Also your ending AC and AB is now 34 (with shield) and 46 (ranged).

With the extra INT and change in class spread, I got 262 skill points which can be spread: Concentration 43(43), Hide 10(21), Move Silently 8(19), Perform 43(56), Spellcraft 43(45), Taunt 32(35), Tumble 40(51), UMD 43(46).

I wouldn't bother with Still Spell as you'll be wearing cloth armor any way (just unequip your shield when buffing). Epic Will isn't needed either as Bard Song will help your saves.

Hope this helps!

Very brief analysis:
 - The second version has a slightly better AB. If I take "Epic prowess", I can raise the AB gap to 2.
 - In my (PW unexperienced) opinion, the second one could be more useful in low-mid magic environment, as only in highly magic environment I can use "Bard song" at its full power:

Perform: base 56, +6 wth CHA enhancing gear, +30 Gloves and I can reach 92 perform (which is however, high)...

 - I am dubious with the arcane archer levels chosen for the second build. I tried to follow the Empyre's advice, with 23 levels of bard, because I wanted to raise the ranged power of this build. However, two levels later (and 10 more perform skill points) the AC benefit gained by the song increases by 1. With one more level of bard, I can have a bonus feat. If I take even on this build "EsF:perform", I can raise the skill to 56, meaning that to achieve the +6 AC bonus (and -6 AC malus wth Curse song) I only have to obtain 19 more skill points.
By enhancing CHA to +12, a +6 modifier added to the previous value allows me to only have to add +13 skill points from gloves or other sources.

What do you think? Do you have other suggestions?
Other builders are welcome to participate in the discussion!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Aquarius 233 wrote:
 - In my (PW unexperienced) opinion, the second one could be more useful in low-mid magic environment, as only in highly magic environment I can use "Bard song" at its full power:


 
I can't pretend to be competent to judge the build(s), but unless I've got this completely wrong (always a possibility), Bard Song is even more valuable in a low-medium magic environment - the lower the better. It's not dispellable (except through silence-type spells) and raises/drops abilities/saves etc in a situation where characters are scrabbling for every little bit of enhancement they can find.

Tiny comment on a big post!

Cheers

Oh - and welcome back!

First of all, Stag is right on spot on this one (again),
the lower the general magic level the better the bard song will be and the harder the PW the more valuable a high level bard,
because people will group in parties in order to win their enemies and thus a party buffer will be invaluable.

Secondly, why not end in a odd AA level and get the additional attack and damage bonusses?
It seems to me that a Bard 29/ SD 2/ AA 9 will be more powerful, same with Bard 27/ SD 2/ AA 11 or even Bard 23/ SD 2/ AA 15.

That's all for now,

I'm sorry for having been misleading; as I know from the (precious) Bard guide written by Mick (and as you Stag and Valerfor said before), the bard song is undispellable. In my previous post I was wondering how can I reach the highest requirement of perform skill, for bard song 30: the outcome of this build is a modified perform skill of 56, and in order to reach the "100" target, I have to:
 - find CHA enhancing gear, to reach the 12 attribute cap (that is, +6 to perform);
 - relate to gloves/boots/cloaks and other possibile source of "Perform".
As I have to raise my "initial" 56 points to 100, I have to find magic items which give me enough skill points (at least 44).
I haven't ever been in PW, as I have only played in single-player, however on the basis of the comments I read in this forum these items can only be available in a high-magic environment (feel free to correct me, if I'm wrong).
Hope that I've clearly explained my thoughts, this time.

However, I have thought that the +/-1 AC bonus/malus due to lv 25 bard song requires me two more bard levels and more perform skills to reach the requirement: the costs are greater that the benefits achieved by lv 25 song. Moreover, the enemy's AC can be lowered by taunt, meaning that my AB increases (so the minor curse song AC malus is compensated).
As a consequence, I have reviewed the build one more time, this time I'm delaying the Arcane archer epic progression in order to obtain as quickly as possible "Lasting inspiration".

What do you think?

I can only think to drop one "Great dexterity" feat to obtain the "Epic Skill Focus: Perform".
 - Benefit: modified skill of perform 56, only 9 points required to maximize the level 23 song (doable in low magic environment).
 - Costs: -1 AB, -1 Reflex save, -1 AC. Moreover, drop another "great dexterity" (because my DEX would end at a odd number) in exchange of....??
MMhhh...maybe the benefit is not worth the costs

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I chose 23 Bard so you could get an odd number of AA levels. In that last build, I would more 11 points from UMD to Taunt, maximizing Taunt, and still leaving 35 net UMD, which is plenty in a low-magic environment, enough to use all scrolls. For that feat you don't know what to do with, how about Epic Fortitude? You could make up for the weak Will save with potions of Clarity.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Can I just ask a question about how Curse Song will work in practice for a ranged character? I may be missing something, but all I can come up with is HiPS-ing in close enough to enemies, singing, then retreating to a safer distance for sniping/casting. Is there a better way?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This is about as good as you can make it Stag.
There is also the old-good UV+Darkness combo that many sneakers use but you have HiPS so, there is no need for that.
What plays more important role is how fast your fingers are, in order to perform those tricks as perfect as you can.
